Contributor.Laboratory: Research Technologies Branch / Microarray Research Facility
Contributor.Organization: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

Platform.Title: NIAID Mycobacterium tuberculosis microarray Mtbb
Platform.Description: Printing by NIAID / Microarray Research Facility Surface type: non-adsorptive, epoxy-coated glass Attachment: covalent Array description: The custom microarrays are manufactured by the Microarray Research Facility of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIH/NIAID). Microarrays are printed with an Omnigrid robotic arrayer by Genomic Solutions (http://www.genomicsolutions.com ) that is fitted with a printhead and 32 SMP3 print tips from Telechem (http://www.arrayit.com ). The M. tuberculosis microarray (Mtbb) probe set is based on 70mer oligonucleotides from Qiagen's Tuberculosis Genome Oligo Set Version 1.0 ( http://oligos.qiagen.com/arrays/omad.php ). Oligonucleotide probes are distributed into 384-well polypropylene plates (Genetix, 384 micro array) and dissolved in print buffer (150mM sodium phosphate, pH 8.5, 4% sodium sulfate, 0.0001% N-lauryl sarcosyl) to a normalized 25 micromolar concentration. The Mtbb microarray spot densities are 270 microns (center-to-center). The microarrays are printed on MWG Epoxy Slides (MWG Biotech Inc., # 1150-000000) or PowerMatrix Slides (Full Moon Biosystems, # PXP-M) and treated by a method that is an adaptation of the manufacturer's instructions to allow higher throughput processing.

Column.Name: ID
Column.Description: NIH mAdb well id plus replicate number

Column.Name: MADB_WELL_ID
Column.Description: NIH mAdb plate-well identifier for oligo sample

Column.Name: CLONE_ID
Column.Description: First CLONE_ID: Sanger Institute H37RV_ORF_name (GenBank Accession Number AL123456); Second CLONE_ID: The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR) CDC1551_ORF_name (GenBank Accession Number AE000516);

Column.Name: CLONE_ID
Column.Description: First CLONE_ID: Sanger Institute H37RV_ORF_name (GenBank Accession Number AL123456); Second CLONE_ID: The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR) CDC1551_ORF_name (GenBank Accession Number AE000516);

Column.Name: SEQUENCE
Column.Description: Sequence of oligonucleotide probe, provided by Operon

Platform.Title: NIAID - Mta[a,b,c]
Platform.Description: Printing by NIAID / Microarray Research Facility Surface type: non-adsorptive, polylysine-coated glass Attachment: covalent, (UV-treated polylysine) Array description: The custom microarrays are manufactured by the Microarray Research Facility of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIH/NIAID). Microarrays are printed with an Omnigrid robotic arrayer by GeneMachines (http://www.genemachines.com) that is fitted with a printhead and 16 SMP5 print tips from Telechem (http://www.arrayit.com). The M. tuberculosis microarray (Mtaa) probe set is based on 70mer oligonucleotides from Qiagen's Tuberculosis Genome Oligo Set V1 (http://oligos.qiagen.com/arrays/omad.php). Oligonucleotide probes are distributed into 384-well polypropylene plates (Genetix, 384 micro array) and dissolved in 4XSSC print buffer at a normalized 25 micromolar concentration. The Mtaa microarray spot densities are 250 microns(center-to-center). The microarrays are printed on poly-L-lysine coated slides and post-processed according to the procedures on the Stanford website: http://cmgm.stanford.edu/pbrown/protocols/index.html

Column.Name: ID
Column.Description: NIH mAdb system Well_ID plus replicate number

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: First ORF column represents Sanger Institute H37RV_ORF_name ; second ORF column represents The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR) CDC1551_ORF_name;

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: First ORF column represents Sanger Institute H37RV_ORF_name ; second ORF column represents The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR) CDC1551_ORF_name;

Column.Name: SEQUENCE
Column.Description: Sequence of oligonucleotide probe, provided by Operon

Series.Title: Transcriptional Responses of M. tuberculosis to inhibitors of metabolism
Series.Summary: Transcriptional profiling of M.tuberculosis was performed using 430 whole-genome microarrays to measure the effects of 75 different drugs, drug combinations or different growth conditions at various times relative to a sample of logarithmically growing MTb. Analysis of this data set revealed 150 underlying clusters of coordinately regulated genes as described in Boshoff et al., 2004. Keywords = Gene clusters Keywords = Mechanism of action Keywords = tuberculosis Keywords = antimycobacterial drugs Keywords = natural product Keywords = respiration Keywords: other
